alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Forsyth; North Fulton; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 1:22PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Paulding, Cherokee, western Forsyth, Cobb, northeastern Fulton and southeastern Bartow Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 122 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Reavis Mountain to near White, and moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Canton, Cartersville, Cumming, Mountain Park, Peachtree Corners, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Milton, Kennesaw, Duluth, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Holly Springs and Austell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Forsyth; North Fulton; Paulding
